analyzed: de bzhin du nam mkha' rdo rje rnam pa med pa yin na yang de ji ltar de bzhin nyid la dmigs pa can yin /
translated: In the same way, if the vajra of space is without aspects, how could it be the object of suchness?

original: de la dmigs pa can yin na yang nga ni thams cad du gtogs pa dang / thams cad kyi rjes su lta ba yin no zhes rnam par rtog par thal bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de la dmigs pa can yin na yang nga ni thams cad du gtogs pa dang / thams cad kyi rjes su lta ba yin no zhes rnam par rtog par thal bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If it is an object of observation, then it follows that I would be a conceptual thought, and that I would be a view that is included in everything and that follows after everything.

original: de la re zhig dang por shin tu ngo mtshar du gyur ba nyid gsal ba'i phyir de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa la /
analyzed: de la re zhig dang por shin tu ngo mtshar du gyur ba nyid gsal ba'i phyir de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa la /
translated: In response to that, first, in order to clarify that which is very amazing, it is said,

original: sku dang gsung dang thugs ni sku la sogs pa ro gcig pa'i byang chub kyi sems so //
analyzed: sku dang gsung dang thugs ni sku la sogs pa ro gcig pa'i byang chub kyi sems so //
translated: Body, speech, and mind are the enlightenment mind that is of one taste with the body, and so on.

original: de nyid ni rdo rje ste /
analyzed: de nyid ni rdo rje ste /
translated: That is a vajra.

original: de gang gi phyag na bsnams pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de gang gi phyag na bsnams pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: He who holds it in his hand is so called.

original: chos zhes bya ba ni gzugs can no //
analyzed: chos zhes bya ba ni gzugs can no //
translated: The dharma is the physical.

original: mi ldan te zhes bya ba ni ldan pa nyid du rtag tu mi snang ba ste /
analyzed: mi ldan te zhes bya ba ni ldan pa nyid du rtag tu mi snang ba ste /
translated: It is not possessed, that is, it does not appear as a possession at all.

original: nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched thob pa rnams ni rnam pa thams cad du gzugs kyi 'du shes las 'das nas nam mkha' mtha' yas tsam du snang ba'i phyir ldan pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched thob pa rnams ni rnam pa thams cad du gzugs kyi 'du shes las 'das nas nam mkha' mtha' yas tsam du snang ba'i phyir ldan pa yang ma yin no //
translated: Those who have attained the sphere of infinite space are not even endowed with it, because they transcend the notion of form in every way and only perceive infinite space.

original: mi ldan pa yang ma yin te zhes bya ba ni mi ldan pa nyid rtag tu snang ba ma yin te /
analyzed: mi ldan pa yang ma yin te zhes bya ba ni mi ldan pa nyid rtag tu snang ba ma yin te /
translated: Nor are they not endowed with it, because non-endowment does not always appear.

original: gzugs mthong ba rnams kyis nam mkha' nyid la gzugs thams cad mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs mthong ba rnams kyis nam mkha' nyid la gzugs thams cad mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: For those who see form see only space.

original: nam mkha' ni 'di snyam du yang mi sems so zhes bya ba ni nam mkha' la rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: nam mkha' ni 'di snyam du yang mi sems so zhes bya ba ni nam mkha' la rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: Space does not think, because there is no conceptualization in space.

original: 'gro zhing rgyun mi 'chad par mthong ba ni rjes su lta ba'o //
analyzed: 'gro zhing rgyun mi 'chad par mthong ba ni rjes su lta ba'o //
translated: Seeing it as going and flowing is seeing it as following.

original: de dang ldan pas na rjes su lta ba can te /
analyzed: de dang ldan pas na rjes su lta ba can te /
translated: One who possesses that is one who follows it.

original: nga ni mtha' yas pa dang 'ba' zhig tu mthong bar bya ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: nga ni mtha' yas pa dang 'ba' zhig tu mthong bar bya ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that I am seen as infinite and alone.

original: de bzhin du zhes bya ba ni gzugs can gyi rdzas dang nam mkha'i tshul du'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du zhes bya ba ni gzugs can gyi rdzas dang nam mkha'i tshul du'o //
translated: Likewise means in the manner of material form and space.

original: rmi lam zhes bya ba ni rmi lam lta bur snang ba'i phyir te sems de la dmigs pa ni sems tsam yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rmi lam zhes bya ba ni rmi lam lta bur snang ba'i phyir te sems de la dmigs pa ni sems tsam yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Dream means like a dream, because of the appearance, because the mind that focuses on that is mind only.

original: rmi lam dang mtshungs pa de rnams kyi dam tshig ni ro gcig pa'i ye shes te /
analyzed: rmi lam dang mtshungs pa de rnams kyi dam tshig ni ro gcig pa'i ye shes te /
translated: The pledge of those who are like a dream is the wisdom of one taste.

original: nam mkha' rdo rje'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' rdo rje'o //
translated: It is the vajra of space.

original: de las byung ba ni der ro gcig par gyur bas snang bar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de las byung ba ni der ro gcig par gyur bas snang bar shes par bya'o //
translated: Arisen from that means that it should be understood as an appearance that has become one taste in that.

original: de 'di skad du sems pa la dmigs pa las chos thams cad sems tsam du shes par gyur @43b pa yin na yang blo 'khrul ba'i phyir rang gi sems mtshan nyid kyi rgyu mtshan yang dag pa ma yin pa dang ldan pa snang ngo //
analyzed: de 'di skad du sems pa la dmigs pa las chos thams cad sems tsam du shes par gyur @43b pa yin na yang blo 'khrul ba'i phyir rang gi sems mtshan nyid kyi rgyu mtshan yang dag pa ma yin pa dang ldan pa snang ngo //
translated: This is what is said: “When all phenomena are known as mind only from the focus on the mind, still, because of the error of the intellect, one’s mind appears to possess the unreal characteristics of objects.”

original: nam mkha' rdo rje ni de rnams dang bral ba yin te /
analyzed: nam mkha' rdo rje ni de rnams dang bral ba yin te /
translated: The vajra of space is free from those.

original: yid la mi byed pas yongs su spong zhing de rnams nub pas yang dag pa la so sor rtog pa'i stobs bskyed pa'i phyir lhun gyis grub pa'i nam mkha'i rdo rje shin tu 'khrul ba med par skyed pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yid la mi byed pas yongs su spong zhing de rnams nub pas yang dag pa la so sor rtog pa'i stobs bskyed pa'i phyir lhun gyis grub pa'i nam mkha'i rdo rje shin tu 'khrul ba med par skyed pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Because of not attending to them, they are completely abandoned. Because of their disappearance, the power of discernment of reality is generated. Because of the generation of the diamond of the sky, which is spontaneous, there is no error.

original: de bas na sems la dmigs pa la sna tshogs par snang zhing nam mkha' rdo rje la ni ro gcig pa yin pa de ltar na 'di 'gal ba ci zhig yod /
analyzed: de bas na sems la dmigs pa la sna tshogs par snang zhing nam mkha' rdo rje la ni ro gcig pa yin pa de ltar na 'di 'gal ba ci zhig yod /
translated: Therefore, there is no contradiction in the fact that the mind is observed as various, and the diamond of the sky is observed as one taste.

original: sems ji lta bur gyur pa skye ba de lta bur gyur pa nyid du snang ba ste /
analyzed: sems ji lta bur gyur pa skye ba de lta bur gyur pa nyid du snang ba ste /
translated: The mind arises in such and such a way, and it appears in such and such a way.

original: gsal ba'i mtshan nyid can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsal ba'i mtshan nyid can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it has the characteristic of clarity.

original: de ltar gsal bar gyur pa nyid kyis 'di de ltar gyur pa'i bdag nyid du rig pa de'i phyir ji ltar 'di ni de ltar gyur pa 'byung ba 'gal ba med pa de bzhin du de lta bur gyur ba'i bdag nyid rig pa yang yin pa'i phyir rang
analyzed: de ltar gsal bar gyur pa nyid kyis 'di de ltar gyur pa'i bdag nyid du rig pa de'i phyir ji ltar 'di ni de ltar gyur pa 'byung ba 'gal ba med pa de bzhin du de lta bur gyur ba'i bdag nyid rig pa yang yin pa'i phyir rang
translated: Because it is clear in this way, it is aware of itself as having this nature. Therefore, just as it is not contradictory for something to arise in this way, in the same way, it is not contradictory for awareness to be aware of itself as having this nature.

original: rig pa la yang 'gal ba yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rig pa la yang 'gal ba yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Thus there is no contradiction in reflexive awareness.

original: dgongs pa nges par 'grel ba las kyang byams pas gsol ba /
analyzed: dgongs pa nges par 'grel ba las kyang byams pas gsol ba /
translated: In the Samdhinirmocana Sutra, Maitreya asks:

original: bcom ldan 'das ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul gyi gzugs brnyan gal te sems de las tha dad pa ma lags na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul gyi gzugs brnyan gal te sems de las tha dad pa ma lags na /
translated: Bhagavan, if the reflection that is the object of concentration is not different from the mind,

original: sems de nyid kyis sems de nyid la ji ltar rtogs par bgyid lags ;
analyzed: sems de nyid kyis sems de nyid la ji ltar rtogs par bgyid lags ;
translated: how does that mind itself cognize that mind itself?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Bhagavan replied:

original: byams pa de la chos gang yang chos gang la yang chos gang la yang rtog par mi byed mod kyi /
analyzed: byams pa de la chos gang yang chos gang la yang chos gang la yang rtog par mi byed mod kyi /
translated: Maitreya, in that case, no phenomenon whatsoever cognizes any phenomenon whatsoever.

original: 'on kyang de ltar skyes pa'i sems gang yin pa de de ltar snang ngo zhes gsungs pa dang / gnyis su gyur pa la rag las pa'i gcod par byed pas gcad par bya ba rnam pa gnyis su byed pa de'i phyir bdag nyid gcod pa la 'gal ba yin pa de ltar na dpe dang 'dra ba ma yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang de ltar skyes pa'i sems gang yin pa de de ltar snang ngo zhes gsungs pa dang / gnyis su gyur pa la rag las pa'i gcod par byed pas gcad par bya ba rnam pa gnyis su byed pa de'i phyir bdag nyid gcod pa la 'gal ba yin pa de ltar na dpe dang 'dra ba ma yin no //
translated: But it is said that the mind that arises in that way appears in that way, and the agent of cutting is dependent on the duality of the object of cutting. Therefore, the self-cutting is contradictory. Thus, it is not like the example.

original: 'di ltar chos thams cad la gnyis kyis stong pa nyid du yang dag par rig pa nyid dmigs pa yin gyi gzung ba nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar chos thams cad la gnyis kyis stong pa nyid du yang dag par rig pa nyid dmigs pa yin gyi gzung ba nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: Thus, the emptiness of duality of all phenomena is the object of knowledge, not the object of grasping.

original: mtshan ma nyid kyis dben pa nyid ni nam mkha' rdo rje'i rnam pa yin te /
analyzed: mtshan ma nyid kyis dben pa nyid ni nam mkha' rdo rje'i rnam pa yin te /
translated: The absence of characteristics itself is the aspect of the vajra of space.

original: de nyid kyis de yang dag par rig pa 'grub pa'i phyir dang / rnam pa gzhan gyis grub pa ma yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de nyid kyis de yang dag par rig pa 'grub pa'i phyir dang / rnam pa gzhan gyis grub pa ma yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because that itself is the establishment of the knowledge of that, and it is not established by any other aspect.

original: dper na bum par snang bas dben pa mthong bas sa phyogs su bum pas stong pa nyid du 'grub kyis gzhan gyis ni ma yin pa lta bu'o //🔽theg pa chen po bsdus @44a * //
analyzed: dper na bum par snang bas dben pa mthong bas sa phyogs su bum pas stong pa nyid du 'grub kyis gzhan gyis ni ma yin pa lta bu'o // theg pa chen po bsdus @44a * //
translated: For example, the emptiness of a pot in a place is established by seeing the place empty of a pot, not by anything else.

original: pa las kyang /
analyzed: pa las kyang /
translated: The Compendium of the Great Vehicle also says:

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis shes //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis shes //
translated: Bodhisattvas know

original: rnam rtog med pa'i dmigs pa ni //
analyzed: rnam rtog med pa'i dmigs pa ni //
translated: The nonconceptual object,

original: chos rnams brjod du med pa nyid //
analyzed: chos rnams brjod du med pa nyid //
translated: The inexpressibility of phenomena,

original: bdag med de bzhin nyid kyang de //🔽byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis shes //
analyzed: bdag med de bzhin nyid kyang de // byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis shes //
translated: Selflessness, and suchness.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i rnam pa'i'o //🔽shes bya dmigs pa de nyid la //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i rnam pa'i'o // shes bya dmigs pa de nyid la //
translated: The bodhisattvas’ aspect🔽Is the absence of signs

original: mtshan ma med pa gang yin pa'o //🔽zhes bshad do //
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa gang yin pa'o // zhes bshad do //
translated: With regard to that very object of knowledge.

original: 'o na ji ltar rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes 'di rnam pa med pa zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes 'di rnam pa med pa zhes bya zhe na /
translated: If it is asked, “Well then, how is this nonconceptual wisdom called ‘without aspect’?”

original: gnyis kyi rnam pas stong pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyis kyi rnam pas stong pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: It is because it is empty of the aspect of duality.

original: ji ltar na dmigs pa med pa zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na dmigs pa med pa zhes bya zhe na /
translated: If it is asked, “How is it called ‘without object’?”

original: gzung ba'i don gzhan la mi rtog pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: gzung ba'i don gzhan la mi rtog pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: It is because it does not conceive of an external object to apprehend.

original: / de ltar na rnam par mi rtog pa de nyid nam mkha' rdo rje chos thams cad du gtogs pa de ni de bzhin nyid rig cing nyams su myong ba na yang 'di ltar nga ni thams cad du gtogs pa la thams cad kyi rjes su blta'o snyam
analyzed: / de ltar na rnam par mi rtog pa de nyid nam mkha' rdo rje chos thams cad du gtogs pa de ni de bzhin nyid rig cing nyams su myong ba na yang 'di ltar nga ni thams cad du gtogs pa la thams cad kyi rjes su blta'o snyam
translated: Thus, that very non-conceptuality, which is the space-vajra of all phenomena, is suchness. When it is known and experienced, one should not think, “I am the all-pervading one who sees all.”

original: du yang rnam par rtog par mi byed do //
analyzed: du yang rnam par rtog par mi byed do //
translated: One should not conceptualize in that way.

original: de de ltar na shin tu ngo mtshar du gyur pa mdor bsdus pas gsal nas rgyas par ngo mtshar du gyur pa gsal ba'i phyir bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de de ltar na shin tu ngo mtshar du gyur pa mdor bsdus pas gsal nas rgyas par ngo mtshar du gyur pa gsal ba'i phyir bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Thus, having clarified the extremely wondrous in brief, in order to clarify the wondrous in detail, [the Bhagavān] declares “Bhagavān” and so on.

original: 'dir ni gzung ba med pa ston par byed do //🔽gzugs kyi phung po las gzhan gzung bar bya ba'i rdzas nyid du yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba de ni rab tu grags pa yin la /
analyzed: 'dir ni gzung ba med pa ston par byed do // gzugs kyi phung po las gzhan gzung bar bya ba'i rdzas nyid du yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba de ni rab tu grags pa yin la /
translated: Here, he teaches the non-existence of the apprehended.🔽“The substance that is to be apprehended, which is other than the form aggregate, does not exist” is well-known.

original: gzugs kyi phung po ni yod pa ma yin no zhes ma grags pa de 'dis dngos su brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs kyi phung po ni yod pa ma yin no zhes ma grags pa de 'dis dngos su brjod par bya'o //
translated: “The form aggregate does not exist” is not well-known. That should be directly stated by this [verse].

original: 'di lta ste zhes bya ba ni tshig rtsom pa'o //
analyzed: 'di lta ste zhes bya ba ni tshig rtsom pa'o //
translated: Thus is the beginning of the sentence.

original: dper na zhes bya ba ni ji ltar rab tu grags pa'o //
analyzed: dper na zhes bya ba ni ji ltar rab tu grags pa'o //
translated: For example is as is well known.

original: de gang zhe na /
analyzed: de gang zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: nam mkha'i gzugs can ma yin pa bltar mi snang ba ste /
analyzed: nam mkha'i gzugs can ma yin pa bltar mi snang ba ste /
translated: Space is formless, invisible.

original: gzugs kyi phung po'i rang bzhin med pa'i phyir gzugs can ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs kyi phung po'i rang bzhin med pa'i phyir gzugs can ma yin pa'o //
translated: It is formless because it does not have the nature of the form aggregate.

original: de nyid kyi phyir mig gi rnam par shes pa 'dis bltar snang ba med pa'i phyir bltar mi snang ba ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir mig gi rnam par shes pa 'dis bltar snang ba med pa'i phyir bltar mi snang ba ste /
translated: For that very reason, it is invisible because it is not seen by this eye consciousness.

original: nam mkha' la ni gzugs can gyi rdzas med pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nam mkha' la ni gzugs can gyi rdzas med pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because space has the characteristic of being devoid of material substances.

original: de bzhin du zhes bya ba ni nam mkha' dang 'dra ba nyid du chos thams cad gzugs can ma yin zhing bltar mi snang ba shes par bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du zhes bya ba ni nam mkha' dang 'dra ba nyid du chos thams cad gzugs can ma yin zhing bltar mi snang ba shes par bya ste /
translated: Thus, like space, all phenomena should be understood to be formless and invisible.🔽Formless means not having the nature of the form aggregate.

original: gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin dang bral ba'i gzugs kyi phung po dang skye mched bcu dang khams bcu po don dam par yod pa nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin dang bral ba'i gzugs kyi phung po dang skye mched bcu dang khams bcu po don dam par yod pa nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: The intended meaning is that the form aggregate, the ten bases, and the ten elements, which are devoid of the nature of one and many, do not exist ultimately.

original: gal te gzhan gyi sems la sogs pa gzung ba yod pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te gzhan gyi sems la sogs pa gzung ba yod pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhe na /
translated: If you say that the apprehended, such as the mind of another, exists,

original: @44b ji ltar snang ba ni med pa nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / ji ltar yod pa nyid ni mi snang ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: @44b ji ltar snang ba ni med pa nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / ji ltar yod pa nyid ni mi snang ba'i phyir te /
translated: then the appearance is non-existent, and what exists does not appear.

original: de dag kyang gzung ba ma yin pa de ltar ni skyon yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag kyang gzung ba ma yin pa de ltar ni skyon yod pa ma yin no //
translated: And if those are not apprehended, there is no fault.

original: 'dzin pa med par ston pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dzin pa med par ston pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the absence of an apprehender,

original: bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he said, “Bhagavān,” and so on.

original: stong pa nyid du gsungs pa gang yin pa de 'di lta ste /
analyzed: stong pa nyid du gsungs pa gang yin pa de 'di lta ste /
translated: What is taught as emptiness is as follows.

original: dper na mdo sde gzhan dag tu rab tu grags pa'i chos thams cad rgyas pa de mdor bsdus nas lus dang ngag dang sems kyi dam tshig gi de kho na nyid de bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: dper na mdo sde gzhan dag tu rab tu grags pa'i chos thams cad rgyas pa de mdor bsdus nas lus dang ngag dang sems kyi dam tshig gi de kho na nyid de bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: For example, just as the extensive explanation of all phenomena that is well known in other sūtras is summarized in the reality of the commitments of body, speech, and mind, so should it be known.

original: ci 'dra ba zhig ce na /
analyzed: ci 'dra ba zhig ce na /
translated: What is it like?

original: thams cad kyi rjes su song ba ste /
analyzed: thams cad kyi rjes su song ba ste /
translated: It is all-pervading.

original: chos thams cad la yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos thams cad la yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it exists in all phenomena.

original: ngo bo nyid gcig pa ni zhes bya ba ni ji ltar gzung ba de dang de'i rang bzhin gyis stong pa de bzhin du 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin gyis kyang stong ste /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid gcig pa ni zhes bya ba ni ji ltar gzung ba de dang de'i rang bzhin gyis stong pa de bzhin du 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin gyis kyang stong ste /
translated: It is of one nature means that just as what is apprehended is empty of the nature of that, so also what apprehends is empty of the nature of that.

original: gzung ba med na 'dzin pa yang mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzung ba med na 'dzin pa yang mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because if there is no apprehended object, there is no apprehending subject.

original: 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin gang gis she na gang lhag mar gyur pa'i phung po bzhi dang khams brgyad dang skye mched bcu gnyis so //
analyzed: 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin gang gis she na gang lhag mar gyur pa'i phung po bzhi dang khams brgyad dang skye mched bcu gnyis so //
translated: By what nature of apprehending? It is the remaining four aggregates, the eight constituents, and the twelve sense spheres.

original: de ltar ni rnam par shes par byed pas na rnam par shes pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar ni rnam par shes par byed pas na rnam par shes pa ste /
translated: Thus, because it makes known, it is consciousness.

original: de yang don gyi rang gi ngo bo tsam 'dzin pa yin la /
analyzed: de yang don gyi rang gi ngo bo tsam 'dzin pa yin la /
translated: Moreover, it is the apprehension of the mere nature of the object.

original: don de nyid kyi khyad par 'dzin pa'i sems las byung ba'i tshor ba dang 'du shes dang 'du byed dag yin no //
analyzed: don de nyid kyi khyad par 'dzin pa'i sems las byung ba'i tshor ba dang 'du shes dang 'du byed dag yin no //
translated: The feelings, discriminations, and compositional factors that apprehend the particularities of that object are mental factors.🔽Thus, since there is no apprehended object or apprehending subject, what other nature could remain, by virtue of which one would think that they are of the same nature?

original: de ltar na gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin med pa'i phyir rang bzhin gzhan gang zhig lus na gang gis de ngo bo nyid gcig pa yin snyam pa la de'i phyir 'di lta ste sems kyi ngo bo nyid do zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de ltar na gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin med pa'i phyir rang bzhin gzhan gang zhig lus na gang gis de ngo bo nyid gcig pa yin snyam pa la de'i phyir 'di lta ste sems kyi ngo bo nyid do zhes gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “It is the nature of mind itself.”

original: gsal ba'i mtshan nyid can gyi sems 'di nyid ni thog ma med pa nas gnyis su rtog pa'i bag chags kyis bslad pa'i phyir gnyis med kyang gnyis kyi rnam par byung ba yin te /
analyzed: gsal ba'i mtshan nyid can gyi sems 'di nyid ni thog ma med pa nas gnyis su rtog pa'i bag chags kyis bslad pa'i phyir gnyis med kyang gnyis kyi rnam par byung ba yin te /
translated: This mind, which has the characteristic of clarity, is unmixed, but it arises in the aspect of duality because it is contaminated by the latent imprints of the conception of duality since beginningless time.

original: rmi lam la sogs pa lta bu'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rmi lam la sogs pa lta bu'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is like a dream and so on.

original: gzhung 'di tsam gyis ni sems la dmigs pa la chos thams cad kyi de kho na nyid sems tsam nyid ces snang ba ci 'dra ba yin pa de rab tu bsgrubs pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhung 'di tsam gyis ni sems la dmigs pa la chos thams cad kyi de kho na nyid sems tsam nyid ces snang ba ci 'dra ba yin pa de rab tu bsgrubs pa yin no //
translated: By this much of the treatise, the suchness of all phenomena, mind-only, is well established as the appearance in the mind.

original: nam mkha'i rdo rjer snang ba ci 'dra ba yin pa de rab tu bsgrub pa'i phyir lus dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te ;
analyzed: nam mkha'i rdo rjer snang ba ci 'dra ba yin pa de rab tu bsgrub pa'i phyir lus dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te ;
translated: In order to well establish the appearance in the vajra of space, it is said:🔽the elements of body, speech, and mind.

original: lus dang ngag dang sems kyi khams ni chos thams cad snang ba'i lus can rnams kyi rang bzhin yin te /
analyzed: lus dang ngag dang sems kyi khams ni chos thams cad snang ba'i lus can rnams kyi rang bzhin yin te /
translated: The elements of body, speech, and mind are the nature of all phenomena, which are embodied in appearances.

original: yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid 'di ni gnyis kyis stong pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid 'di ni gnyis kyis stong pa nyid yin no //
translated: This is the perfected nature, which is emptiness of duality.

original: nam mkha'i khams ni rang bzhin te /
analyzed: nam mkha'i khams ni rang bzhin te /
translated: The element of space is the nature.

original: dag pa'i nam mkha'o //
analyzed: dag pa'i nam mkha'o //
translated: It is pure space.🔽Both of them are nondual

original: de dag gnyi ga yang gnyis su med cing @45a * //🔽gnyis su dbyer med pa ste /
analyzed: de dag gnyi ga yang gnyis su med cing @45a * // gnyis su dbyer med pa ste /
translated: and indivisible.

original: khyad par med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: khyad par med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that there is no difference.

original: chos kyi rang gi mtshan nyid rnams ni gnyis po brdzun pa'i mtshan ma'o //
analyzed: chos kyi rang gi mtshan nyid rnams ni gnyis po brdzun pa'i mtshan ma'o //
translated: The individual characteristics of phenomena are the characteristics of the two, which are false.

original: khyad par nyid kyis yongs su grub pa ma yin pa nyid do zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: khyad par nyid kyis yongs su grub pa ma yin pa nyid do zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: The meaning is that it is not fully present due to its own characteristics.

original: 'di tsam gyis ni chos thams cad rang gi mtshan nyid du yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba rab tu 'grub pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di tsam gyis ni chos thams cad rang gi mtshan nyid du yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba rab tu 'grub pa yin no //
translated: By this much, it is well established that all phenomena do not exist by their own characteristics.

original: chos nyid kyang mtshan nyid ji lta ba bzhin du yod pa ma yin no zhes rab tu bsgrub pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa la 'di lta ste zhes bya ba ni de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos nyid kyang mtshan nyid ji lta ba bzhin du yod pa ma yin no zhes rab tu bsgrub pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa la 'di lta ste zhes bya ba ni de'i phyir ro //
translated: In order to well establish that even reality does not exist as it is characterized, the Bhagavān said, “It is thus,” and so on. “It is thus” means for that reason.

original: nam mkha'i khams la gnas te zhes bya ba ni nam mkha' lta bu'i chos kyi dbyings la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: nam mkha'i khams la gnas te zhes bya ba ni nam mkha' lta bu'i chos kyi dbyings la gnas pa'o //
translated: Abiding in the space element means abiding in the space-like dharmadhātu.

original: ji ltar na nam mkha' lta bu yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na nam mkha' lta bu yin zhe na /
translated: How is it like space?

original: dper na zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: dper na zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: It is said, “For example,”

original: 'das ma thag pa nyid du ji ltar rab tu bsgrubs pa'o //
analyzed: 'das ma thag pa nyid du ji ltar rab tu bsgrubs pa'o //
translated: just as it was well established immediately before.

original: ji ltar de rnams de la gnas she na /
analyzed: ji ltar de rnams de la gnas she na /
translated: How do they abide in that?

original: nam mkha' dang 'dra ba'i tshad med pa dang rtag pa de'i nang du tshad yod pa dang ; mi rtag pa de rnams 'dus pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: nam mkha' dang 'dra ba'i tshad med pa dang rtag pa de'i nang du tshad yod pa dang ; mi rtag pa de rnams 'dus pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because the finite and the impermanent are included within the infinite and the permanent, which are like space.

original: de yang zhes bya ba ni chos kyi dbyings so //
analyzed: de yang zhes bya ba ni chos kyi dbyings so //
translated: And that means the dharma-dhātu.

original: 'dod pa'i khams la sogs pa la gnas pa ma yin pa ni nang du 'dus pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams la sogs pa la gnas pa ma yin pa ni nang du 'dus pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not located in the desire realm, etc., because it is not included within them,

original: tshad med pa'i phyir dang / rtag pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: tshad med pa'i phyir dang / rtag pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because it is infinite and permanent.

original: de las cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de las cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What is the consequence of that?

original: chos gang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: chos gang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: He says, “Whatever dharma,” etc.

original: rtag par mi nus so zhes bya ba ni brtan par nus pa ma yin la /
analyzed: rtag par mi nus so zhes bya ba ni brtan par nus pa ma yin la /
translated: It cannot be permanent means it cannot be stable.

original: brtan par nus pa nang du 'gyur pa'i mtshan nyid can yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: brtan par nus pa nang du 'gyur pa'i mtshan nyid can yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because stability has the characteristic of being internal.

original: dper na khar gzhong gis rgya shug gi 'bras bu lta bu'o zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: dper na khar gzhong gis rgya shug gi 'bras bu lta bu'o zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: For example, it is like a plate of food, he thinks.

original: gang gi phyir 'ga' zhig ltar yang brtan par bya ba ma yin pa de'i phyir 'ga' zhig gi yang chos nyid ma yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'ga' zhig ltar yang brtan par bya ba ma yin pa de'i phyir 'ga' zhig gi yang chos nyid ma yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Because it is not stable in any way, therefore it is not the reality of anything.

original: de bas na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni mjug bsdu ba yin te /
analyzed: de bas na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni mjug bsdu ba yin te /
translated: Thus, etc. concludes.

original: gang gi phyir mtshan nyid can ji lta ba bzhin du chos ma yin pa de bas na rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid dag gis chos thams cad ni ngo bo nyid med pa yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir mtshan nyid can ji lta ba bzhin du chos ma yin pa de bas na rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid dag gis chos thams cad ni ngo bo nyid med pa yin te /
translated: Because the phenomena are not as they are characterized, therefore all phenomena are essenceless by way of their own and general characteristics.

original: ngo bo nyid med pa gang gis spros pa'i rgyu mtshan thams cad nub pa'i dri ma med pa nam mkha'i rdo rje la snang ngo zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid med pa gang gis spros pa'i rgyu mtshan thams cad nub pa'i dri ma med pa nam mkha'i rdo rje la snang ngo zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: By what essencelessness all the signs of conceptual elaboration subside, that stainlessness appears in the sky-vajra.

original: nam mkha' rdo rje ni byang chub kyang ma yin byang chub kyi sems kyang ma yin pa de bas na 'di bsgoms pas cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: nam mkha' rdo rje ni byang chub kyang ma yin byang chub kyi sems kyang ma yin pa de bas na 'di bsgoms pas cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: The sky-vajra is neither enlightenment nor the spirit of enlightenment. Therefore, what is the point of meditating on it?

original: bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The Blessed One, etc.

original: @45b 'di lta ste zhes bya ba ni nam mkha'i rdo rje nyid de byang chub kyi sems so //
analyzed: @45b 'di lta ste zhes bya ba ni nam mkha'i rdo rje nyid de byang chub kyi sems so //
translated: Thus means the vajra of space itself, which is the thought of awakening.

original: dper na zhes bya ba ni ji ltar rab tu grags pa'i theg pa chen po la'o //
analyzed: dper na zhes bya ba ni ji ltar rab tu grags pa'i theg pa chen po la'o //
translated: For example means in the Great Vehicle, which is well known.

original: ci'i phyir de byang chub kyi sems yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de byang chub kyi sems yin zhe na /
translated: Why is that the thought of awakening?

original: gang gi phyir de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi ye shes te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi ye shes te /
translated: Because it is the wisdom of all the tathāgatas,

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad do //
translated: all the qualities of a buddha.

original: de rnams 'byung ba ni bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams 'byung ba ni bskyed pa'o //
translated: The arising of those is the generation.

original: rdo rje'i gnas ni rdo rje 'chang chen po'i go 'phang ste /
analyzed: rdo rje'i gnas ni rdo rje 'chang chen po'i go 'phang ste /
translated: The vajra stage is the state of Great Vajradhara,

original: bla na med pa'i byang chub po //
analyzed: bla na med pa'i byang chub po //
translated: unsurpassed awakening.

original: de byed pa ni thob par byed pa ste /
analyzed: de byed pa ni thob par byed pa ste /
translated: The one who does that is the one who attains it,

original: rgyu zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rgyu zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: the meaning of cause.

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs gang yin pa de la dmigs pa can gyi sems ma yin nam /
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs gang yin pa de la dmigs pa can gyi sems ma yin nam /
translated: Is it not the case that the thought of awakening is focused on the body, speech, and mind of the buddhas?

original: de ci'i phyir nam mkha'i rdo rje yin zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir nam mkha'i rdo rje yin zhe na /
translated: Why is that the vajra of space?

original: de'i phyir byang chub kyi sems zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir byang chub kyi sems zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Therefore it is said, the thought of awakening, and so on.

original: don dam par byang chub kyi sems ni lus la sogs pa la dmigs pa can ma yin te /
analyzed: don dam par byang chub kyi sems ni lus la sogs pa la dmigs pa can ma yin te /
translated: In reality, the thought of awakening is not focused on the body, etc.

original: 'khrul pa med pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'khrul pa med pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is free from error.

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyi sku dang gsung yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyi sku dang gsung yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: The bodies and speech of the Buddhas do not exist,

original: gzung ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzung ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no object.

original: thugs kyang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: thugs kyang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: The mind also does not exist,

original: 'dzin pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dzin pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no subject.🔽The bodies, speech, and minds of the Buddhas, which are characterized by the awareness of the body, etc., and which are the perfect enjoyment and emanation bodies, are not the principal

original: sku la sogs pa'i rnam par rig pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi sku dang gsung dang thugs sangs rgyas rnams kyi longs spyod rdzogs pa dang sprul pa can gang yin pa de yang dag pa'i 'jig rten pa rnam par rtog pa'i rang bzhin nyid yin pa'i phyir gtso bo'i🔽byang chub ma yin no //
analyzed: sku la sogs pa'i rnam par rig pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi sku dang gsung dang thugs sangs rgyas rnams kyi longs spyod rdzogs pa dang sprul pa can gang yin pa de yang dag pa'i 'jig rten pa rnam par rtog pa'i rang bzhin nyid yin pa'i phyir gtso bo'i byang chub ma yin no //
translated: thought of awakening, because they are of the nature of the imagination of the unreal, which is worldly.🔽The thought of awakening that is focused is also not the principal one.

original: dmigs pa dang bcas pa'i byang chub kyi sems kyang gtso bo ma yin no zhes bya ba thugs la bzhag nas /
analyzed: dmigs pa dang bcas pa'i byang chub kyi sems kyang gtso bo ma yin no zhes bya ba thugs la bzhag nas /
translated: Having reflected on this,

original: chos gang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa la /
analyzed: chos gang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa la /
translated: The passage beginning with “that dharma” explains the absence of the afflictions.

original: chos gang zhes bya ba ni sems kyi rgyun rnam par byang bar gnas gyur pa'o //
analyzed: chos gang zhes bya ba ni sems kyi rgyun rnam par byang bar gnas gyur pa'o //
translated: “That dharma” is the continuum of mind that abides in the state of purification.

original: khams gsum na mi gnas pa zhes bya ba ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos yang dag pa ma yin pa kun du rtog pa'i rang bzhin can thams cad ni khams gsum pa yin la /
analyzed: khams gsum na mi gnas pa zhes bya ba ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos yang dag pa ma yin pa kun du rtog pa'i rang bzhin can thams cad ni khams gsum pa yin la /
translated: “It does not exist in the three realms” means that all the dharmas of affliction, which are of the nature of unreal imagination, are in the three realms.

original: de la mi gnas pa ni de'i rgyu mtshan du mi gnas pa ste /
analyzed: de la mi gnas pa ni de'i rgyu mtshan du mi gnas pa ste /
translated: “It does not exist there” means that it does not exist as the causal basis of that.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa can gyi chos thams cad kyi sa bon ni der 'phags pa'i lam gyis yongs su zad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa can gyi chos thams cad kyi sa bon ni der 'phags pa'i lam gyis yongs su zad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the seeds of all afflicted dharmas are completely exhausted there by the noble path.

original: de la skye ba med de zhes bya ba ni de la kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos 'byung ba ni yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de la skye ba med de zhes bya ba ni de la kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos 'byung ba ni yod pa ma yin te /
translated: “There is no arising there” means that the arising of afflicted dharmas there does not exist.

original: sa bon med pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sa bon med pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it does not exist because the seeds do not exist.

original: 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la gang gnas @46a * //
analyzed: 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la gang gnas @46a * //
translated: The passage beginning with “this” explains the absence of the result.

original: yongs su gyur pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi chos gang yin pa 'di ni kun nas nyon mongs pa can gyi sa bon thams cad zad pa yin pas na rnam par dag pa yin la /
analyzed: yongs su gyur pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi chos gang yin pa 'di ni kun nas nyon mongs pa can gyi sa bon thams cad zad pa yin pas na rnam par dag pa yin la /
translated: This reality, which has the characteristic of the transformation, is pure, because it is the exhaustion of all the seeds of defilement.

original: lus dang gnas dang longs spyod du snang ba'i rnam par rtog pa rnams nub pa'i phyir nam mkha' dang mnyam pa ste /
analyzed: lus dang gnas dang longs spyod du snang ba'i rnam par rtog pa rnams nub pa'i phyir nam mkha' dang mnyam pa ste /
translated: It is equal to space, because the conceptual thoughts which appear as the body, the place, and the enjoyments, have disappeared.

original: 'di nyid ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi ye shes 'byung ba'i rdo rje'i gnas yin no //
analyzed: 'di nyid ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi ye shes 'byung ba'i rdo rje'i gnas yin no //
translated: This is the vajra-site of the origin of the knowledge of all the Tathagatas.

original: de bas na de byed pa nam mkha'i rdo rje ni byang chub kyi sems kyi mchog yin no zhes dgongs so //
analyzed: de bas na de byed pa nam mkha'i rdo rje ni byang chub kyi sems kyi mchog yin no zhes dgongs so //
translated: Therefore, the sky-vajra, which is its agent, is the supreme thought of enlightenment.

original: gang gi tshe de nyid rdo rje'i gnas yin pa de'i tshe de bzhin gshegs pa rnams mdzad pa med pa dang / sku la sogs pa mi mnga' ba yin na de rnams kyi sku dang gsung gi khyad par sna tshogs pas de rnams kyis 'gro ba ma lus pa'i don mdzad pa gzhan dag gis ji ltar dmigs par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe de nyid rdo rje'i gnas yin pa de'i tshe de bzhin gshegs pa rnams mdzad pa med pa dang / sku la sogs pa mi mnga' ba yin na de rnams kyi sku dang gsung gi khyad par sna tshogs pas de rnams kyis 'gro ba ma lus pa'i don mdzad pa gzhan dag gis ji ltar dmigs par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: When this is a vajra point, then the Tathagatas are without activity and do not possess a body, etc. How is it that others perceive the performance of their benefit for all beings through the various distinctions of their bodies and speech?

original: de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa la /
analyzed: de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa la /
translated: Therefore, he says, Blessed One, etc.

original: rmi lam zhes bya ba ni gnyid log pa'o ;
analyzed: rmi lam zhes bya ba ni gnyid log pa'o ;
translated: Dream means sleep.

original: / khams gsum du rmi lam zhes bya ba ni khams gsum gyi rnam par rtog pa dang 'gro ba la sogs pa'i las rmi lam du mthong ba'o //
analyzed: / khams gsum du rmi lam zhes bya ba ni khams gsum gyi rnam par rtog pa dang 'gro ba la sogs pa'i las rmi lam du mthong ba'o //
translated: The dream of the three realms is the perception of the conceptualization of the three realms and the karma of going, etc.

original: de rnams kyang zhes bya ba ni rmi lam du ston pa'i rnam par rtog pa la sogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rnams kyang zhes bya ba ni rmi lam du ston pa'i rnam par rtog pa la sogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They also means the conceptualization, etc. of the dream.

original: rmi lam lta bu zhes bya ba ni dang po'i rmi lam mthong zhing rmi lam gyi bya ba'i rang bzhin can gyi bya ba de la ji ltar gnyid log pa dang skyes bu dag la 'dod pa'i rtog pa med cing g-yo 'gul med pa de bzhin du sems
analyzed: rmi lam lta bu zhes bya ba ni dang po'i rmi lam mthong zhing rmi lam gyi bya ba'i rang bzhin can gyi bya ba de la ji ltar gnyid log pa dang skyes bu dag la 'dod pa'i rtog pa med cing g-yo 'gul med pa de bzhin du sems
translated: “Like a dream” means that, just as in the first watch of the night, when one is seeing a dream, the dreamer is not aware of the nature of the dream, and the dream objects are not aware of themselves, in the same way,

original: las rmi lam gyi khams gsum pa phyi rol na med bzhin du ste /🔽rang gi bya ba la smra bar 'dod pa med pa de bas na 'di ni rmi lam lta bu'o /
analyzed: las rmi lam gyi khams gsum pa phyi rol na med bzhin du ste / rang gi bya ba la smra bar 'dod pa med pa de bas na 'di ni rmi lam lta bu'o /
translated: the mind is not aware of the dream objects of the three realms, which are external to it.🔽Since the dream objects are not aware of themselves as objects of speech, they are like a dream.

original: g-yo 'gul med pa de bas na 'di ni rmi lam dang 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: g-yo 'gul med pa de bas na 'di ni rmi lam dang 'dra ba'o //
translated: Since they are not aware of themselves as objects of movement, they are like a dream.

original: rmi lam las byung ba zhes bya ba ni rmi lam dang lhan cig ro gcig pa ste /
analyzed: rmi lam las byung ba zhes bya ba ni rmi lam dang lhan cig ro gcig pa ste /
translated: “Arisen from a dream” means that they are of the same taste as the dream.

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin par snang ba dag ni brdzun pa nyid kyis na der snang ba dag ni ro gcig pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin par snang ba dag ni brdzun pa nyid kyis na der snang ba dag ni ro gcig pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Since the appearance of the grasped and the grasper is false, the appearance of the dream objects is of the same taste as the dream.

original: rmi lam la bdag med pa'i gnas zhes bya ba ni rmi lam mthong ba rnams kyis bdag med pa'i gnas 'di ni bdag med pa'i tshul gang yin pa de rtogs par bya ste mthong bar gyur pa de rnams kyang mthong bas na 'khrul pa'i rgyu mtshan tsam nyid
analyzed: rmi lam la bdag med pa'i gnas zhes bya ba ni rmi lam mthong ba rnams kyis bdag med pa'i gnas 'di ni bdag med pa'i tshul gang yin pa de rtogs par bya ste mthong bar gyur pa de rnams kyang mthong bas na 'khrul pa'i rgyu mtshan tsam nyid
translated: The phrase “the abode of selflessness in dreams” means that the abode of selflessness should be realized by those who see dreams. That which is seen as selflessness is merely a cause of error,

original: kyis mi rtog pa nyid dang / g-yo 'gul med pa nyid kyi phyir dang / snang ba tsam nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kyis mi rtog pa nyid dang / g-yo 'gul med pa nyid kyi phyir dang / snang ba tsam nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is non-conceptual, because it is motionless, and because it is mere appearance.

original: de la @46b rdo rje'i tshig 'di gsungs pa gang yin pa de la sangs rgyas rnams kyi sku gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: de la @46b rdo rje'i tshig 'di gsungs pa gang yin pa de la sangs rgyas rnams kyi sku gang yin zhe na /
translated: Here, what is the Buddha’s body that is referred to in these vajra statements?

original: chos kyi sku zhes bya bar sbyar ste /
analyzed: chos kyi sku zhes bya bar sbyar ste /
translated: It should be connected with the phrase “the body of Dharma.”

original: der sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad kyi sa bon gyis yongs su gang ba nyid kyi phyir sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams skyed par byed pa yin pa de bas na chos rnams kyi ston pa yin pa de ltar na chos kyi sku zhes bya'o //
analyzed: der sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad kyi sa bon gyis yongs su gang ba nyid kyi phyir sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams skyed par byed pa yin pa de bas na chos rnams kyi ston pa yin pa de ltar na chos kyi sku zhes bya'o //
translated: Because it is filled with the seeds of all the Buddha’s qualities, it is the producer of the Buddha’s qualities. Therefore, it is the teacher of the Dharma. Thus, it is called the body of Dharma.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams kyang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams kyang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The qualities of a buddha are also of two kinds.

original: de la la la ni don dam pa mthong ba'i phyir rnam pa med pa nyid kyis 'jig rten las 'das pa yin la /🔽la la ni chos kyi longs spyod nyid kyi phyir ram /
analyzed: de la la la ni don dam pa mthong ba'i phyir rnam pa med pa nyid kyis 'jig rten las 'das pa yin la / la la ni chos kyi longs spyod nyid kyi phyir ram /
translated: Some are supramundane, because they are seen by the vision of the ultimate.🔽Some are pure mundane, because they are associated with aspects, either for the enjoyment of Dharma or

original: gzhan gyi don gyi phyir rnam pa dang bcas pa nyid kyis dag pa 'jig rten pa yin te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi don gyi phyir rnam pa dang bcas pa nyid kyis dag pa 'jig rten pa yin te /
translated: for the benefit of others.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i rgyu mthun pa dang gnyis su mngon par zhen pa med pa nyid kyi phyir dang / gnyis kyis stong pa nyid la rtag tu 'khrul pa med pa'i phyir dag pa yang yin la rnam pa dang bcas pa yin pa nyid kyi phyir 'jig rten pa yang yin pas na dag pa 'jig rten pa'o//
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i rgyu mthun pa dang gnyis su mngon par zhen pa med pa nyid kyi phyir dang / gnyis kyis stong pa nyid la rtag tu 'khrul pa med pa'i phyir dag pa yang yin la rnam pa dang bcas pa yin pa nyid kyi phyir 'jig rten pa yang yin pas na dag pa 'jig rten pa'o//
translated: They are pure because they are the natural outcome of nonconceptuality and because they are the absence of clinging to duality, and they are mundane because they are associated with aspects and because they are never confused about emptiness.

original: 'jig rten pa'i rnam par rtog pa thams cad ni sangs rgyas rnams kyis shin tu spang bar 'dod do //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i rnam par rtog pa thams cad ni sangs rgyas rnams kyis shin tu spang bar 'dod do //
translated: All mundane conceptual thoughts are to be completely eliminated by the buddhas.

original: mchog tu gnas gyur pa kun nas nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi sa bon zad pa can gang yin pa de ni mya ngan las 'das pa yin la /
analyzed: mchog tu gnas gyur pa kun nas nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi sa bon zad pa can gang yin pa de ni mya ngan las 'das pa yin la /
translated: Nirvana is the supreme transformation, the exhaustion of the seeds of all affliction.

original: de nyid ni zag pa med pa'i dbyings yin zhing de ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas dang nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi rnam par grol ba'i sku ma yin no //
analyzed: de nyid ni zag pa med pa'i dbyings yin zhing de ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas dang nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi rnam par grol ba'i sku ma yin no //
translated: That itself is the uncontaminated realm, and it is the liberated body of the perfect Buddha, the sravakas, and pratyekabuddhas.

original: gang gi tshe yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi de nyid chos kyi sku yin pa de'i tshe nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dag gi yang yin par 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: gang gi tshe yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi de nyid chos kyi sku yin pa de'i tshe nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dag gi yang yin par 'gyur ba'am /
translated: When that is the dharmakaya of the perfect Buddha, it is also the dharmakaya of the sravakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: yang na 'ga' zhig gi yang rnam par grol ba'i sku chos kyi skur mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: yang na 'ga' zhig gi yang rnam par grol ba'i sku chos kyi skur mi 'gyur la /
translated: Or else, the liberated body of some would not be the dharmakaya.

original: de la sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams med pa ni nam mkha'i me tog dang 'dra bar des skye ba mi rung ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: de la sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams med pa ni nam mkha'i me tog dang 'dra bar des skye ba mi rung ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Since it is devoid of the qualities of a buddha, it would be like a sky flower, since it is unsuitable for it to arise.

original: de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, the Bhagavat, etc.

original: de bzhin du sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad kyang rjes su rtogs par bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad kyang rjes su rtogs par bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Thus, one should understand all the qualities of a Buddha in the same way.

original: de ltar ni dper na yid bzhin gyi nor bu rin po che ni rin po che thams cad kyi gtso bo yin zhing yid bzhin gyi nor bu rin po che'i yon tan dang ldan gyi gzhan dag ni ma yin no //🔽de bzhin du sangs rgyas kyi rnam par grol ba'i sku ni rnam par @47a * //
analyzed: de ltar ni dper na yid bzhin gyi nor bu rin po che ni rin po che thams cad kyi gtso bo yin zhing yid bzhin gyi nor bu rin po che'i yon tan dang ldan gyi gzhan dag ni ma yin no // de bzhin du sangs rgyas kyi rnam par grol ba'i sku ni rnam par @47a * //
translated: For example, a wish-fulfilling gem is the best of all gems, and it possesses the qualities of a wish-fulfilling gem, but not the others.

original: grol ba'i sku thams cad kyi gtso bo yin zhing sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad kyi sa bon sngon gyi tshogs kyi stobs bskyed pa'i mtshan nyid can dang ldan pa yin gyi gzhan dag ni ma yin no //
analyzed: grol ba'i sku thams cad kyi gtso bo yin zhing sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad kyi sa bon sngon gyi tshogs kyi stobs bskyed pa'i mtshan nyid can dang ldan pa yin gyi gzhan dag ni ma yin no //
translated: In the same way, the Buddha’s liberated body is the best of all liberated bodies, and it possesses the seed of all the qualities of a Buddha, which is characterized by the power of the previous accumulations, but not the others.

original: ji ltar yid bzhin gyi nor bu rin po che de ni mngon par 'du byed pa med par don du gnyer ba rnams la gser ram rin po che'am dngul bsams pa tsam gyis 'byor bar byed kyi gzhan dag gis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar yid bzhin gyi nor bu rin po che de ni mngon par 'du byed pa med par don du gnyer ba rnams la gser ram rin po che'am dngul bsams pa tsam gyis 'byor bar byed kyi gzhan dag gis ni ma yin no //
translated: Just as that precious wish-fulfilling gem, without any deliberation, provides gold, jewels, and silver for those who desire them, merely by their wishing, but not for others.

original: de bzhin du sangs rgyas rnams kyi rnam par grol ba'i sku yang mngon par 'du mdzad pa med par sems can skal ba dang ldan pa rnams kyi don du rang gi sku dang gsung dang thugs /
analyzed: de bzhin du sangs rgyas rnams kyi rnam par grol ba'i sku yang mngon par 'du mdzad pa med par sems can skal ba dang ldan pa rnams kyi don du rang gi sku dang gsung dang thugs /
translated: In the same way, the emanation body of the buddhas, without any deliberation, provides for the benefit of fortunate sentient beings, merely by their wish, the vision of their own body, speech, and mind.

original: sems can gyi skal ba tsam gyis skyed par mdzad kyi gzhan dag gis ni ma yin no /
analyzed: sems can gyi skal ba tsam gyis skyed par mdzad kyi gzhan dag gis ni ma yin no /
translated: But not for others.

original: ji ltar gser dang rin po che dang dngul de dag gi don du gnyer ba rnams kyi sems la yang mi gnas yid bzhin gyi nor bu la gnas pa yang ma yin pa de ltar na yang de dag las 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji ltar gser dang rin po che dang dngul de dag gi don du gnyer ba rnams kyi sems la yang mi gnas yid bzhin gyi nor bu la gnas pa yang ma yin pa de ltar na yang de dag las 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Just as those who desire gold, jewels, and silver do not have those things in their minds, nor do they have them in the wish-fulfilling gem, but still they come from it.

original: de bzhin du sangs rgyas rnams kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs ni sangs rgyas rnams kyi rnam par grol ba'i sku la yang mi gnas pa sems can gyi rgyud la gnas pa yang ma yin pa de ltar na yang de dag las 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du sangs rgyas rnams kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs ni sangs rgyas rnams kyi rnam par grol ba'i sku la yang mi gnas pa sems can gyi rgyud la gnas pa yang ma yin pa de ltar na yang de dag las 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: And yet, they arise from them.

original: chos thams cad ces bya ba ni chos thams cad la yang de bzhin du rjes su rtogs par bya ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad ces bya ba ni chos thams cad la yang de bzhin du rjes su rtogs par bya ste /
translated: All phenomena should be understood in the same way.

original: yid bzhin gyi nor bu dang gser la sogs pa'i tshul du rgyud dang rkyen rnams la yod pa ma yin bzhin du chos thams cad 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: yid bzhin gyi nor bu dang gser la sogs pa'i tshul du rgyud dang rkyen rnams la yod pa ma yin bzhin du chos thams cad 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: Like wish-fulfilling gems, gold, and so on, all phenomena arise from causes and conditions, even though they do not exist in them.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos 'ba' zhig ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos 'ba' zhig ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is not only the qualities of the Buddha that are like this.

original: de bas na chos kyi sku ni yod de de yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams nyid kyi yin gyi nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bas na chos kyi sku ni yod de de yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams nyid kyi yin gyi nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the Dharma Body exists, and it belongs to the Perfectly Awakened Ones alone, not to the Sravakas and Pratyekabuddhas.

original: bcom ldan 'das gang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la de ngo mtshar ro zhes bya ba ni zab pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la de ngo mtshar ro zhes bya ba ni zab pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The word amazing in the phrase amazing and marvelous indicates profundity.

original: nam mkha'i khams ni chos kyi sku'o //
analyzed: nam mkha'i khams ni chos kyi sku'o //
translated: The element of space is the Dharma Body.

original: de'i rjes su 'brang ba ni bsdus pa ste /
analyzed: de'i rjes su 'brang ba ni bsdus pa ste /
translated: The word consisting of indicates inclusion.

original: 'di dag la de nyid du sa bon 'gog pas ni shin tu 'gog pa yod pa'i phyir de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: 'di dag la de nyid du sa bon 'gog pas ni shin tu 'gog pa yod pa'i phyir de skad ces bya'o //
translated: It is called cessation because the seeds of these are completely stopped in it.

original: chos thams cad kyis zhes bya ba la ni kun nas nyon mongs pa rnams kyi'o //🔽rjes su 'brang ba zhes bya ba ni chos kyi sku de nyid du rtag pa'i sa bon gyis gnas pas de nyid las rtag tu 'byung ba'i @47b phyir ro //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyis zhes bya ba la ni kun nas nyon mongs pa rnams kyi'o //🔽rjes su 'brang ba zhes bya ba ni chos kyi sku de nyid du rtag pa'i sa bon gyis gnas pas de nyid las rtag tu 'byung ba'i @47b phyir ro //
translated: The word all refers to the defiled dharmas.🔽The word consisting of indicates inclusion.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi ye shes 'byung ba rdo rje'i gnas nyid ni byang chub kyi gtso bo yin la /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi ye shes 'byung ba rdo rje'i gnas nyid ni byang chub kyi gtso bo yin la /
translated: The abode of the vajra of the origin of the gnosis of all the tathagatas is the chief of enlightenments.

original: de byed pa nam mkha'i rdo rje nyid ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i byang chub kyi sems yin te /
analyzed: de byed pa nam mkha'i rdo rje nyid ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i byang chub kyi sems yin te /
translated: The agent of that, the vajra of space itself, is the supramundane mind of enlightenment.

original: sems la dmigs pa ni sbyor ba las byung ba'i byang chub kyi sems yin no zhes bya ba der gnas so /
analyzed: sems la dmigs pa ni sbyor ba las byung ba'i byang chub kyi sems yin no zhes bya ba der gnas so /
translated: The observation of the mind is the mind of enlightenment arisen from practice.

original: de la rmi lam gyi mtshan ma mthong bas nges par dngos grub phra mo la sems la dmigs pa bsgom par bya ba yin la /
analyzed: de la rmi lam gyi mtshan ma mthong bas nges par dngos grub phra mo la sems la dmigs pa bsgom par bya ba yin la /
translated: There, by seeing the signs in a dream, one should cultivate the observation of the mind for the sake of the subtle spiritual powers.

original: dngos grub mchog la ni de'i sngon du 'gro ba'i nam mkha' rdo rje yin no //
analyzed: dngos grub mchog la ni de'i sngon du 'gro ba'i nam mkha' rdo rje yin no //
translated: For the sake of the supreme spiritual powers, the vajra of space is the preliminary.

original: de la de dag gi gdams ngag brjod par bya ba yin la /
analyzed: de la de dag gi gdams ngag brjod par bya ba yin la /
translated: There, the instruction for that should be stated.

original: dang po'i skabs dbye ba'i phyir de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: dang po'i skabs dbye ba'i phyir de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In order to open the first section, he said “then,” and so on.

original: zhabs gnyis la phyag 'tshal ba ni gdams ngag gnyis la gus pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: zhabs gnyis la phyag 'tshal ba ni gdams ngag gnyis la gus pa'i phyir te /
translated: The homage to the two feet is out of respect for the two instructions.

original: sngags kyi rdo rje ni sngags kyi lha rnams te /🔽de rnams kyi dngos grub bo //🔽de rnams kyi mdor bsdus pa ni rnam pa mang po'o //
analyzed: sngags kyi rdo rje ni sngags kyi lha rnams te / de rnams kyi dngos grub bo // de rnams kyi mdor bsdus pa ni rnam pa mang po'o //
translated: The vajra of mantra is the mantra deities.🔽Their powers are the many kinds of powers.🔽Their summary is the many kinds of powers.

original: mdor bsdus pa'i dngos grub ni dngos grub rnam pa mang po'o //
analyzed: mdor bsdus pa'i dngos grub ni dngos grub rnam pa mang po'o //
translated: The powers are the many kinds of powers.

original: gnas pa ni de la gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnas pa ni de la gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Abiding is because of abiding in that.

original: 'byung ba ni de'i bdag nyid du 'dus pa thob pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'byung ba ni de'i bdag nyid du 'dus pa thob pa'i phyir te /
translated: Arising is because of attaining the collection in the nature of that.

original: gnas pa dang 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gnas pa dang 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of “will abide and arise” is that.

original: 'di snyam du 'dir sems la dmigs pa ni dngos grub nye bar bya ba'i phyir sgom par byed pa yin na de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di snyam du 'dir sems la dmigs pa ni dngos grub nye bar bya ba'i phyir sgom par byed pa yin na de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: If one thinks that here the observation of mind is cultivated in order to bring about the proximity of power, that is not reasonable.

original: de ni rang gi sems bsgom pa yin na rang gi sems las grub pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni rang gi sems bsgom pa yin na rang gi sems las grub pa yang ma yin no //
translated: If that is the cultivation of one’s own mind, it is not accomplished from one’s own mind.

original: 'o na ci yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci yin zhe na /
translated: What is it then?

original: lha rnams kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs las yin te /
analyzed: lha rnams kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs las yin te /
translated: It is from the body, speech, and mind of the deities.

original: gzhan du na bsgom pa de don med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na bsgom pa de don med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Otherwise, that cultivation would be pointless.

original: de bas na dngos grub 'di lha'i sku dang gsung dang thugs nyid la gnas pa dang / de las byung ba yin no snyam na /
analyzed: de bas na dngos grub 'di lha'i sku dang gsung dang thugs nyid la gnas pa dang / de las byung ba yin no snyam na /
translated: Therefore, if one thinks that this spiritual power is based on the body, speech, and mind of the deity, and arises from that,

original: de dgag par bya ba'i phyir bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de dgag par bya ba'i phyir bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: in order to refute that, [the Bhagavān] declares, “The spiritual powers . . .”

original: sgrub pa pos thob par bya ba'i dngos grub rnams lha rnams kyi sku gsum la mi gnas pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: sgrub pa pos thob par bya ba'i dngos grub rnams lha rnams kyi sku gsum la mi gnas pa nyid yin no //
translated: The spiritual powers that are to be attained by the practitioner are not based on the three bodies of the deities.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba ni rgyu gang las kyang ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba ni rgyu gang las kyang ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Why? means “for no reason at all.”

original: sa bon gzhan dag las 'bras bu gzhan 'byung ba ni med do zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: sa bon gzhan dag las 'bras bu gzhan 'byung ba ni med do zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: The idea is that an effect does not arise from a different seed.

original: 'o na gang la gnas she na /
analyzed: 'o na gang la gnas she na /
translated: Well, then, where are they based?

original: 'on kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /🔽sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad ces bya ba ni sangs rgyas @48a * //
analyzed: 'on kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te / sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad ces bya ba ni sangs rgyas @48a * //
translated: [The Bhagavān] declares, “But rather . . .”

original: kyi chos kyi rang bzhin sna tshogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: kyi chos kyi rang bzhin sna tshogs pa rnams so //
translated: All the qualities of a Buddha means the various natures of the qualities of a Buddha.

original: 'dir rdo rje'i sgras ni lha'i sku dang gsung dang thugs la bya bar bshad do //
analyzed: 'dir rdo rje'i sgras ni lha'i sku dang gsung dang thugs la bya bar bshad do //
translated: Here, the term “vajra” is explained as referring to the body, speech, and mind of the deity.

original: bdag gi lus dang ngag dang sems nyid rdo rje yin te /
analyzed: bdag gi lus dang ngag dang sems nyid rdo rje yin te /
translated: One’s own body, speech, and mind are vajras,

original: bdag gi lus dang ngag dang sems nyid la lha'i sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi tshul du mos pas bsgom pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag gi lus dang ngag dang sems nyid la lha'i sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi tshul du mos pas bsgom pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because one meditates by imagining one’s own body, speech, and mind in the form of the body, speech, and mind of the deity.

original: de la gnas pa'i rgyu dang dngos grub kyi gnas skabs kyi 'bras bu ni las de dang tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: de la gnas pa'i rgyu dang dngos grub kyi gnas skabs kyi 'bras bu ni las de dang tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: The cause of abiding in that, and the result of the state of power, are not different from that action, this is the idea.

original: lha'i sku la sogs par mos pa ni dngos grub kyi rang bzhin yin la /
analyzed: lha'i sku la sogs par mos pa ni dngos grub kyi rang bzhin yin la /
translated: Imagining the body of the deity, etc., is the nature of power.

original: de'ang shin tu ring du gnas pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: de'ang shin tu ring du gnas pa ma yin nam /
translated: And that does not last very long, does it?

original: de bas na de dag ni rang gi lus la sogs pa la gnas pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de bas na de dag ni rang gi lus la sogs pa la gnas pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: Therefore, they do not abide in one’s own body, etc.

original: lus dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: lus dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: To respond to that, he says, “body, etc.”

original: 'di nyid du snang bar gyur ba ni 'di las gzhan pa 'dod pa'i khams la sogs pa la gnas pa ni mi rigs te /
analyzed: 'di nyid du snang bar gyur ba ni 'di las gzhan pa 'dod pa'i khams la sogs pa la gnas pa ni mi rigs te /
translated: It is not reasonable that one who appears here abides in another place, such as the desire realm,

original: gang du snang ba de nyid du gnas pa'i phyir te tshad mas grub pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: gang du snang ba de nyid du gnas pa'i phyir te tshad mas grub pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: because one abides in the very place where one appears, and because this is established by valid cognition.

original: 'on kyang tha dad pa med pa'i phyir rang gi lus la sogs pa la gnas pa ni bla ste /
analyzed: 'on kyang tha dad pa med pa'i phyir rang gi lus la sogs pa la gnas pa ni bla ste /
translated: However, it is better to abide in one's own body, etc., because they are not different.

original: 'byung ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'byung ba ni ma yin te /
translated: But they are not the elements,

original: lha'i sku la sogs pa ni rang gi sems kyi yul nyid yin pa'i phyir ram rang gi sems la snang ba'i phyir dang rten dang brten pa dag tha dad pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: lha'i sku la sogs pa ni rang gi sems kyi yul nyid yin pa'i phyir ram rang gi sems la snang ba'i phyir dang rten dang brten pa dag tha dad pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: because the divine body, etc. are the object of one's own mind, or because they appear to one's own mind, and because the support and the supported are different.

original: de'i phyir sems kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir sems kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, it is said that the mind, etc.

original: gsal ba'i bdag nyid can gyi sems las tha mi dad pa nyid kyi phyir lus kyi khams su snang ba yin gyi rten dang brten pa nyid kyis ni ma yin no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: gsal ba'i bdag nyid can gyi sems las tha mi dad pa nyid kyi phyir lus kyi khams su snang ba yin gyi rten dang brten pa nyid kyis ni ma yin no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: because they are not different from the mind which has the nature of clarity, they appear as the element of the body, but not by way of support and supported.

original: de nyid gsal bar bya ba'i phyir /🔽de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa la de zhes bya ba ni de dag la ste /
analyzed: de nyid gsal bar bya ba'i phyir / de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa la de zhes bya ba ni de dag la ste /
translated: In order to make that clear, he says,

original: sems dang sems la de dag ni mi gnas pa nyid ni dper na steng dang 'og gi nam mkha' rten dang brten pa'i ngo bo nyid dag cing stong pa ni gzugs can ma yin pa nyid kyis thogs pa med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: sems dang sems la de dag ni mi gnas pa nyid ni dper na steng dang 'og gi nam mkha' rten dang brten pa'i ngo bo nyid dag cing stong pa ni gzugs can ma yin pa nyid kyis thogs pa med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Why is it so? and so on. There, in those, the mind and speech do not abide, just as the upper and lower space, which are pure and empty by way of the nature of support and supported, are unobstructed because they are formless.

original: de bzhin du lus la sems dang ngag la sems ni sems tsam nyid yin pas na thogs pa med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du lus la sems dang ngag la sems ni sems tsam nyid yin pas na thogs pa med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: In the same way, the mind in the body and the mind in speech are unobstructed because they are just the mind only.

original: de bas na rang gi lus dang ngag dang sems rang gi lha'i sku dang gsung dang thugs ni rang gi sems nyid yin te /
analyzed: de bas na rang gi lus dang ngag dang sems rang gi lha'i sku dang gsung dang thugs ni rang gi sems nyid yin te /
translated: Therefore, one’s own body, speech, and mind are the body, speech, and mind of one’s own deity, which is one’s own mind.

original: de'i bdag nyid las ma gtogs par @48b rang gi sems snang bar mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid las ma gtogs par @48b rang gi sems snang bar mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not suitable for one’s mind to appear apart from the nature of that.

original: de bas na rang gi sems nyid la dngos grub rnams gnas pa dang 'byung ba yin pa de ltar na sems la dmigs pa ni rigs pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na rang gi sems nyid la dngos grub rnams gnas pa dang 'byung ba yin pa de ltar na sems la dmigs pa ni rigs pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, one’s own mind is the basis and source of powers. Thus, the focus on mind is reasonable.

original: 'dis ni rang gi lus dang ngag dang sems la rang gi lha'i sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi tshul du mos shing gnyi ga'i sku dang gsung dang thugs rang gi sems tsam nyid du mos par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dis ni rang gi lus dang ngag dang sems la rang gi lha'i sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi tshul du mos shing gnyi ga'i sku dang gsung dang thugs rang gi sems tsam nyid du mos par bya'o //
translated: This means that one should imagine one’s own body, speech, and mind in the manner of the body, speech, and mind of one’s own deity, and imagine that the body, speech, and mind of both are one’s own mind alone.

original: 'di ni 'dir sems la dmigs pa yin la 'di nyid ni 'dir dngos grub phra mo'i gdams pa yin no zhes gsung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ni 'dir sems la dmigs pa yin la 'di nyid ni 'dir dngos grub phra mo'i gdams pa yin no zhes gsung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: This is the focus on mind here. This is the instruction on the subtle power here.

original: dngos grub mchog la ni chos kyi sku yang bsgrub par bya ba nyid yin pa'i phyir snga ma bzhin du sems la dmigs pa bsgoms nas nam mkha'i rdo rje bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: dngos grub mchog la ni chos kyi sku yang bsgrub par bya ba nyid yin pa'i phyir snga ma bzhin du sems la dmigs pa bsgoms nas nam mkha'i rdo rje bsgom par bya'o //
translated: But for the supreme power, since even the Dharma Body is to be accomplished, one should meditate on the observation of mind as before, and then meditate on the vajra of space.

original: de la gdams ngag gi skabs dbye ba'i phyir de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de la gdams ngag gi skabs dbye ba'i phyir de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: In order to open the section of instruction, he says thereupon, etc.

original: 'di snyam du gang gi tshe nam mkha' rdo rje la gnas pa dang byung ba yin na /
analyzed: 'di snyam du gang gi tshe nam mkha' rdo rje la gnas pa dang byung ba yin na /
translated: If one thinks, “When it is the case that the deity abides in the vajra of space,

original: de'i tshe lha bsgoms pa don med do zhes sems na rdo rje 'chang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de'i tshe lha bsgoms pa don med do zhes sems na rdo rje 'chang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: then the meditation on the deity is pointless,” [the Bhagavān] says, Vajradhara, etc.

original: rang gi lus dang ngag dang sems la rang gi lha'i sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi tshul dang / rang gi sems tsam nyid du snang ba las gnas pa dang / 'byung ngo zhes bya ba ni lan gyi don yin no //
analyzed: rang gi lus dang ngag dang sems la rang gi lha'i sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi tshul dang / rang gi sems tsam nyid du snang ba las gnas pa dang / 'byung ngo zhes bya ba ni lan gyi don yin no //
translated: The meaning of the reply is that one’s body, speech, and mind are in the manner of one’s deity’s body, speech, and mind, and that they appear as just one’s mind, and abide and arise.

original: 'di tsam gyis ni snga ma bzhin du sems la dmigs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di tsam gyis ni snga ma bzhin du sems la dmigs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: With just this much, he has stated the observation of mind as before.

original: bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa la /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa la /
translated: The Bhagavān said, “What?”

original: gang la gnas zhes bya ba ni de ltar sems tsam nyid du mthong ba na /
analyzed: gang la gnas zhes bya ba ni de ltar sems tsam nyid du mthong ba na /
translated: “What is the basis?” means that when one sees that way, in mind only,

original: ci de nyid la gnas shing brten pa yin nam /
analyzed: ci de nyid la gnas shing brten pa yin nam /
translated: is it based on that?

original: ci nam mkha'i dri ma med pa lta bu'i stong pa nyid la 'gyur grang na /
analyzed: ci nam mkha'i dri ma med pa lta bu'i stong pa nyid la 'gyur grang na /
translated: Or is it in emptiness like the stainless sky?

original: gang gi tshe de nyid la yin pa de'i tshe de nyid de kho na nyid kyi mchog yin pa de ltar na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe de nyid la yin pa de'i tshe de nyid de kho na nyid kyi mchog yin pa de ltar na /
translated: When it is in that, then that is the supreme suchness.

original: ci'i phyir nam mkha'i rdo rje yin la /
analyzed: ci'i phyir nam mkha'i rdo rje yin la /
translated: In that case, why is it the vajra of space?

original: yang na stong pa nyid la yin pa de'i tshe lha'i sku dang gsung dang thugs su snang ba tsam yang med pa'i phyir gang la dngos grub tu 'gyur zhes bya ba bsam pa'o ;
analyzed: yang na stong pa nyid la yin pa de'i tshe lha'i sku dang gsung dang thugs su snang ba tsam yang med pa'i phyir gang la dngos grub tu 'gyur zhes bya ba bsam pa'o ;
translated: Or, when it is in emptiness, then there is not even the mere appearance of the deity’s body, speech, and mind. Therefore, what is the power?

original: / nam mkha' la gnas zhes bya ba ni nam mkha' lta bu'i stong pa nyid la ste /
analyzed: / nam mkha' la gnas zhes bya ba ni nam mkha' lta bu'i stong pa nyid la ste /
translated: “Based in space” means in the emptiness that is like space.

original: stong pa nyid ni de kho na nyid kyi mchog yin gyi rnam par rig pa tsam ni ma yin no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: stong pa nyid ni de kho na nyid kyi mchog yin gyi rnam par rig pa tsam ni ma yin no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: Emptiness is the supreme reality, but not mere representation.

original: de ltar ni dngos po rnams gsal ba tsam gyis rang gi rang bzhin yin te /🔽sgro ma btags pa nyid @49a * //
analyzed: de ltar ni dngos po rnams gsal ba tsam gyis rang gi rang bzhin yin te / sgro ma btags pa nyid @49a * //
translated: Thus, the mere manifestation of things is their intrinsic nature,

original: kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: kyi phyir ro //
translated: because it is not a superimposition.

original: gnyis kyi rgyu mtshan gang yin pa de yang brdzun pa'i ngo bo yin te /
analyzed: gnyis kyi rgyu mtshan gang yin pa de yang brdzun pa'i ngo bo yin te /
translated: And the sign of duality is also a false nature,

original: blo'i 'khrul pas sgro btags pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: blo'i 'khrul pas sgro btags pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because it is a superimposition by the error of the intellect.

original: de bas na sems tsam nyid ni de kho na nyid kyi mchog ma yin te /
analyzed: de bas na sems tsam nyid ni de kho na nyid kyi mchog ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, mere mind is not the supreme reality,

original: de mthong ba na yang dkar po la sogs pa'i rnam pa med pa bzhin du snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de mthong ba na yang dkar po la sogs pa'i rnam pa med pa bzhin du snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because even when it is seen, it appears as having aspects such as white.

original: gnyis kyis stong pa nyid ni mchog yin te /
analyzed: gnyis kyis stong pa nyid ni mchog yin te /
translated: Emptiness of duality is supreme,

original: 'khrul ba'i rgyu mtshan thams cad nub pas de mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'khrul ba'i rgyu mtshan thams cad nub pas de mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is seen when all the signs of error have disappeared.

original: 'o na sngags kyi tshul la ci'i phyir lha'i sku la sogs pa bsgoms she na /
analyzed: 'o na sngags kyi tshul la ci'i phyir lha'i sku la sogs pa bsgoms she na /
translated: Well, why is the deity’s form, etc. , cultivated in the mantra system?

original: pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshul la pha rol tu phyin pa lnga bsgoms pas kyang ci dgos /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshul la pha rol tu phyin pa lnga bsgoms pas kyang ci dgos /
